20101227030052.000|20101227030053.000|CC1|ENDLESS MARCH OF LIFE AND DEATH 
20101227030053.000|20101227030056.000|CC1|AND REBIRTH.

20101227030057.000|20101227030057.000|CC1|SHOULD SEE IT NOW BECAUSE       
20101227030057.000|20101227030058.000|CC1|THERE'S NO GUARANTEE IT WILL BE 
20101227030058.000|20101227030103.000|CC1|AROUND FOREVER.                 
20101227030103.000|20101227030106.000|CC1|>> ELEPHANTS COMMUNICATE IN A   
20101227030106.000|20101227030107.000|CC1|COMPLICATED, SOPHISTICATED      
20101227030107.000|20101227030108.000|CC1|LANGUAGE THAT SCIENTISTS ARE    
20101227030108.000|20101227030110.000|CC1|TRYING TO DECIPHER AND COMPILE  
20101227030110.000|20101227030112.000|CC1|INTO THE WORLD'S FIRST ELEPHANT 
20101227030112.000|20101227030113.000|CC1|DICTIONARY.                     
20101227030113.000|20101227030115.000|CC1|>> THERE ARE PROTEST CALLS.     
20101227030115.000|20101227030118.000|CC1|[ELEPHANT ROARS]                
20101227030118.000|20101227030119.000|CC1|AND NEWBORNS HAVE A VERY HIGH   
20101227030119.000|20101227030120.000|CC1|CRY.                            
20101227030120.000|20101227030121.000|CC1|WHEN YOU HEAR IT, YOU KNOW IT'S 
20101227030121.000|20101227030126.000|CC1|A VERY, VERY YOUNG CALF.        
20101227030126.000|20101227030126.000|CC1|[CRYING]                        
20101227030126.000|20101227030128.000|CC1|>> THESE FEARSOME NOISES ARE    
20101227030128.000|20101227030129.000|CC1|ACTUALLY ELEPHANTS GREETING ONE 
20101227030129.000|20101227030129.000|CC1|ANOTHER.                        
20101227030129.000|20101227030131.000|CC1|GLAD TO SEE YOU.                
20101227030131.000|20101227030141.000|CC1|COME A LITTLE CLOSER.           
20101227030141.000|20101227030143.000|CC1|>> Stahl: THE MOVIE "JURASSIC   
20101227030143.000|20101227030146.000|CC1|PARK" WAS THE STORY OF A        
20101227030146.000|20101227030147.000|CC1|DINOSAUR RED ROAX GONE WRONG,   
20101227030147.000|20101227030150.000|CC1|AND TO THE RESCUE CAME

20101227030153.000|20101227030154.000|CC1|>> I DID.

20101227030314.000|20101227030314.000|XDS|%    TITLE:   
20101227030315.000|20101227030315.000|XDS|%    TITLE: LSTA0010H
20101227030316.000|20101227030316.000|CC1|    And if you wake up often    
20101227030316.000|20101227030319.000|CC1|  in the middle of the night... 
20101227030319.000|20101227030319.000|CC1|          rest is here,         
20101227030319.000|20101227030322.000|CC1|    on the wings of Lunesta.    
20101227030322.000|20101227030322.000|CC1|  Lunesta helps you fall asleep 
20101227030322.000|20101227030325.000|CC1|        and stay asleep,        
20101227030325.000|20101227030325.000|CC1|           so you can           
20101227030325.000|20101227030328.000|CC1|     wake up feeling rested.    
20101227030328.000|20101227030328.000|CC1|When taking Lunesta, don't drive
20101227030328.000|20101227030331.000|CC1|      or operate machinery      
20101227030331.000|20101227030333.000|CC1|   until you feel fully awake.  
20101227030333.000|20101227030333.000|CC1|    Walking, eating, driving,   
20101227030333.000|20101227030336.000|CC1| or engaging in other activities
20101227030336.000|20101227030336.000|CC1|      while asleep, without     
20101227030336.000|20101227030338.000|CC1|  remembering it the next day,  
20101227030338.000|20101227030339.000|CC1|       have been reported.      
20101227030339.000|20101227030339.000|CC1| Abnormal behaviors may include 
20101227030339.000|20101227030342.000|CC1|   aggressiveness, agitation,   
20101227030342.000|20101227030344.000|CC1|  hallucinations or confusion.  
20101227030344.000|20101227030344.000|CC1|     In depressed patients,     
20101227030344.000|20101227030346.000|CC1|    worsening of depression,    
20101227030346.000|20101227030346.000|CC1|   including risk of suicide,   
20101227030346.000|20101227030348.000|CC1|           may occur.           
20101227030348.000|20101227030348.000|CC1|           Alcohol may          
20101227030348.000|20101227030350.000|CC1|      increase these risks.     
20101227030350.000|20101227030350.000|CC1|    Allergic reactions, such    
20101227030350.000|20101227030352.000|CC1|  as tongue or throat swelling, 
20101227030352.000|20101227030354.000|CC1| occur rarely and may be fatal. 
20101227030354.000|20101227030354.000|CC1|    Side effects may include    
20101227030354.000|20101227030356.000|CC1|   unpleasant taste, headache,  
20101227030356.000|20101227030356.000|CC1|            dizziness           
20101227030356.000|20101227030358.000|CC1|     and morning drowsiness.    
20101227030358.000|20101227030358.000|CC1|   Ask your doctor if Lunesta   
20101227030358.000|20101227030401.000|CC1|        is right for you.       
20101227030401.000|20101227030401.000|CC1|         Get Lunesta for        
20101227030401.000|20101227030405.000|CC1|   a $0 CO-PAY at Lunesta.com.  
20101227030405.000|20101227030405.000|CC1|    Sleep well, on the wings    
20101227030405.000|20101227030439.000|CC1|           of Lunesta.

20101227030452.000|20101227030454.000|CC1|MIGRATION."

20101227030456.000|20101227030457.000|CC1|THE MOST SPECTACULAR WILDLIFE

20101227030458.000|20101227030459.000|CC1|A SIGHT THAT COMES AROUND EVERY 
20101227030459.000|20101227030501.000|CC1|YEAR BUT FOR ONLY A SHORT TIME. 
20101227030501.000|20101227030502.000|CC1|MILLIONS OF ANIMALS ON AN       
20101227030502.000|20101227030502.000|CC1|ENDLESS MARCH OF LIFE AND DEATH 
20101227030502.000|20101227030505.000|CC1|AND REBIRTH.                    
20101227030505.000|20101227030506.000|CC1|WE'LL SAVE MOST OF THE          
20101227030506.000|20101227030507.000|CC1|SUPERLATIVES FOR THE PICTURES   
20101227030507.000|20101227030508.000|CC1|BECAUSE YOU MIGHT AGREE THIS IS 
20101227030508.000|20101227030511.000|CC1|ONE OF THE GREATEST SHOWS ON    
20101227030511.000|20101227030515.000|CC1|EARTH.                          
20101227030515.000|20101227030516.000|CC1|WE THOUGHT YOU SHOULD SEE IT    
20101227030516.000|20101227030518.000|CC1|AGAIN NOW, BECAUSE THERE'S NO   
20101227030518.000|20101227030519.000|CC1|GUARANTEE IT WILL BE AROUND     
20101227030519.000|20101227030523.000|CC1|FOREVER.                        
20101227030523.000|20101227030524.000|CC1|THERE WAS A TIME WHEN EPIC      
20101227030524.000|20101227030526.000|CC1|MIGRATIONS WERE COMMON--        
20101227030526.000|20101227030526.000|CC1|MILLIONS OF BUFFALO IN NORTH    
20101227030526.000|20101227030529.000|CC1|AMERICA, FOR EXAMPLE.           
20101227030529.000|20101227030530.000|CC1|BUT TODAY, TO SEE WHAT THAT MUST
20101227030530.000|20101227030531.000|CC1|HAVE BEEN LIKE, YOU HAVE TO     
20101227030531.000|20101227030535.000|CC1|TRAVEL TO EAST AFRICA.          
20101227030535.000|20101227030537.000|CC1|HERE, IN LATE SUMMER, MORE THAN 
20101227030537.000|20101227030539.000|CC1|A MILLION WILDEBEEST CROSS THE  
20101227030539.000|20101227030541.000|CC1|VOLCANIC PLAIN OF THE MASAI MARA
20101227030541.000|20101227030542.000|CC1|IN KENYA, PUSHING THROUGH ONE OF
20101227030542.000|20101227030544.000|CC1|THE MOST AWE-INSPIRING WILDLIFE 
20101227030544.000|20101227030545.000|CC1|HABITATS ON EARTH-- NEARLY      
20101227030545.000|20101227030547.000|CC1|EVERYTHING AFRICA HAS TO OFFER, 
20101227030547.000|20101227030556.000|CC1|ALL IN ONE PLACE.               
20101227030556.000|20101227030558.000|CC1|THE DRY SEASON IS MOVING THE    
20101227030558.000|20101227030559.000|CC1|HERDS, CONCENTRATING THEM WHERE 
20101227030559.000|20101227030614.000|CC1|THERE IS STILL GRASS AND WATER. 
20101227030614.000|20101227030616.000|CC1|IT'S A MARCH OF 350 MILES UP    
20101227030616.000|20101227030617.000|CC1|FROM THE SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK
20101227030617.000|20101227030619.000|CC1|IN TANZANIA TO THE MASAI MARA   
20101227030619.000|20101227030621.000|CC1|NATIONAL RESERVE IN KENYA AND   
20101227030621.000|20101227030627.000|CC1|BACK AGAIN.                     
20101227030627.000|20101227030628.000|CC1|AMERICAN SCIENTIST ROBIN REID   
20101227030628.000|20101227030630.000|CC1|WAS HOOKED THE VERY FIRST TIME  
20101227030630.000|20101227030637.000|CC1|SHE SAW IT AS A STUDENT.        
20101227030637.000|20101227030639.000|CC1|SHE'S ON THE FACULTY AT COLORADO
20101227030639.000|20101227030640.000|CC1|STATE UNIVERSITY, AND HAS SPENT 
20101227030640.000|20101227030641.000|CC1|DECADES STUDYING THE ANIMALS AND
20101227030641.000|20101227030643.000|CC1|THE MASAI PEOPLE WHO SHARE THE  
20101227030643.000|20101227030649.000|CC1|LAND WITH THE MARA MIGRATION.   
20101227030649.000|20101227030650.000|CC1|>> Robin Reid: WE DON'T HAVE    
20101227030650.000|20101227030652.000|CC1|MIGRATIONS ANYMORE THIS LARGE.  
20101227030652.000|20101227030653.000|CC1|SO THIS IS THE ONLY ONE THAT    
20101227030653.000|20101227030653.000|CC1|STANDS BY ITSELF THAT IS THIS   
20101227030653.000|20101227030655.000|CC1|LARGE.                          
20101227030655.000|20101227030656.000|CC1|NOW, IF YOU'RE TALKING ABOUT    
20101227030656.000|20101227030657.000|CC1|BUTTERFLIES OR YOU'RE TALKING   
20101227030657.000|20101227030658.000|CC1|ABOUT BIRDS, YOU'RE TALKING     
20101227030658.000|20101227030659.000|CC1|ABOUT, YOU KNOW, SMALLER        
20101227030659.000|20101227030701.000|CC1|ANIMALS-- ABSOLUTELY.           
20101227030701.000|20101227030701.000|CC1|YOU EASILY GET UP INTO THESE    
20101227030701.000|20101227030703.000|CC1|KINDS OF NUMBERS.               
20101227030703.000|20101227030705.000|CC1|BUT AS FAR AS BIG ANIMALS, YOU  
20101227030705.000|20101227030706.000|CC1|KNOW, THAT ARE WALKING LONG     
20101227030706.000|20101227030707.000|CC1|DISTANCE, YOU KNOW, THIS IS THE 
20101227030707.000|20101227030708.000|CC1|ONE.                            
20101227030708.000|20101227030709.000|CC1|>> Pelley: THIS IS THE LAST ONE 
20101227030709.000|20101227030710.000|CC1|ON EARTH.                       
20101227030710.000|20101227030710.000|CC1|>> Reid: YEP, THE LAST ONE ON   
20101227030710.000|20101227030714.000|CC1|EARTH THAT IS THIS LARGE.       
20101227030714.000|20101227030715.000|CC1|>> Pelley: "WILDEBEEST" IS DUTCH
20101227030715.000|20101227030716.000|CC1|FOR "WILD BEAST," WHICH MAY     
20101227030716.000|20101227030718.000|CC1|REFER MORE TO ITS APPEARANCE    
20101227030718.000|20101227030720.000|CC1|THAN ANY FEROCITY.              
20101227030720.000|20101227030722.000|CC1|IT'S A RELATIVE OF THE ANTELOPE,
20101227030722.000|20101227030722.000|CC1|BUT IT'S UNLIKE ANYTHING YOU'VE 
20101227030722.000|20101227030726.000|CC1|EVER SEEN.                      
20101227030726.000|20101227030727.000|CC1|THEY CALL LIONS "REGAL" AND     
20101227030727.000|20101227030729.000|CC1|ELEPHANTS "MAJESTIC."           
20101227030729.000|20101227030729.000|CC1|I WONDER WHAT YOU'D CALL A      
20101227030729.000|20101227030731.000|CC1|WILDEBEEST?                     
20101227030731.000|20101227030732.000|CC1|>> Reid: ( LAUGHS ) I THINK THEY
20101227030732.000|20101227030733.000|CC1|LOOK INSANE.                    
20101227030733.000|20101227030734.000|CC1|THEIR HORNS ARE KIND OF, YOU    
20101227030734.000|20101227030735.000|CC1|KNOW, THIS WAY AND THAT.        
20101227030735.000|20101227030736.000|CC1|AND THEN THEY HAVE THESE BIG    
20101227030736.000|20101227030736.000|CC1|SHOULDERS, AND WHY IN THE HECK  
20101227030736.000|20101227030737.000|CC1|IS THAT?                        
20101227030737.000|20101227030738.000|CC1|AND THEY'RE A FUNNY COLOR.      
20101227030738.000|20101227030740.000|CC1|YOU KNOW, THEY'RE NOT PRETTY.   
20101227030740.000|20101227030741.000|CC1|AND THEY'VE GOT A LONG TAIL.    
20101227030741.000|20101227030742.000|CC1|YOU KNOW, THEY'RE... THEY'RE PUT
20101227030742.000|20101227030744.000|CC1|TOGETHER IN PIECES.             
20101227030744.000|20101227030745.000|CC1|>> Pelley: WELL, SOMEBODY ONCE  
20101227030745.000|20101227030746.000|CC1|SAID IT LOOKS LIKE AN ANIMAL    
20101227030746.000|20101227030747.000|CC1|THAT'S MADE OUT OF SPARE PARTS. 
20101227030747.000|20101227030749.000|CC1|>> Reid: AND THAT'S VERY APT.   
20101227030749.000|20101227030750.000|CC1|>> Pelley: ALONG WITH THE       
20101227030750.000|20101227030752.000|CC1|WILDEBEEST, THERE ARE HUNDREDS

20101227030812.000|20101227030815.000|CC1|ALL-- CROCODILES THAT PATROL THE
20101227030815.000|20101227030817.000|CC1|MARA RIVER, WHICH CUTS RIGHT

20101227030829.000|20101227030829.000|CC1|POINT IN THE ENTIRE YEAR-LONG

20101227031244.000|20101227031245.000|CC1|BECOMES A WHEAT FIELD IS THAT   
20101227031245.000|20101227031247.000|CC1|CHARCOALERS MOVE TO THE AREA AND
20101227031247.000|20101227031248.000|CC1|CUT DOWN THE TREES TO MAKE ONE

20101227031257.000|20101227031301.000|CC1|TO MAKE A LIVING OFF THE LAND.

20101227031303.000|20101227031307.000|CC1|WATERS INTO THE RIVER.

20101227031548.000|20101227031551.000|CC1|>> Pelley: AS THE WILDEBEEST    
20101227031551.000|20101227031552.000|CC1|MOVED OUT OF THE MASAI MARA, WE 
20101227031552.000|20101227031553.000|CC1|COULD SEE THE BEGINNINGS OF NEXT
20101227031553.000|20101227031556.000|CC1|YEAR'S SPECTACLE.               
20101227031556.000|20101227031558.000|CC1|THE ELEPHANTS WERE RAISING THEIR
20101227031558.000|20101227031601.000|CC1|CALVES, AND THAT CHEETAH WAS    
20101227031601.000|20101227031602.000|CC1|FEEDING HER CUBS ON A GAZELLE   
20101227031602.000|20101227031605.000|CC1|SHE'D KILLED.                   
20101227031605.000|20101227031611.000|CC1|CHEETAH CUBS CHIRP LIKE BIRDS.  
20101227031611.000|20101227031613.000|CC1|AND IF THEY SURVIVE, THEY WILL  
20101227031613.000|20101227031615.000|CC1|STILL BE WITH THEIR MOTHER WHEN 
20101227031615.000|20101227031616.000|CC1|THE WILDEBEEST COME AROUND      
20101227031616.000|20101227031623.000|CC1|AGAIN.                          
20101227031623.000|20101227031623.000|CC1|THIS PERPETUAL CYCLE IS A ROBUST
20101227031623.000|20101227031628.000|CC1|FORCE OF NATURE.                
20101227031628.000|20101227031630.000|CC1|BUT WITH THE MARA RIVER RUNNING 
20101227031630.000|20101227031632.000|CC1|LOW AND MAN CROWDING THE ROUTE, 
20101227031632.000|20101227031633.000|CC1|NO ONE CAN BE CERTAIN HOW MANY  
20101227031633.000|20101227031635.000|CC1|TURNS ARE LEFT FOR THIS, THE    
20101227031635.000|20101227031646.000|CC1|LAST SPECTACLE OF ITS KIND.     
20101227031646.000|20101227031647.000|CC1|WE'LL BE BACK IN A MOMENT WITH  
20101227031647.000|20101227031647.000|CC1|"THE SECRET LANGUAGE OF         
20101227031647.000|20101227031658.000|CC1|ELEPHANTS."

20101227032058.000|20101227032059.000|CC1|INTO THE WORLD'S FIRST ELEPHANT 
20101227032059.000|20101227032104.000|CC1|DICTIONARY.

20101227032122.000|20101227032123.000|CC1|>> Simon: THE SANGHA RIVER FLOWS

20101227032444.000|20101227032446.000|CC1|THEIR NUMBERS, MONITORING THEIR 
20101227032446.000|20101227032447.000|CC1|HEALTH, AND OBSERVING THEIR     
20101227032447.000|20101227032450.000|CC1|SOCIAL BEHAVIOR.                
20101227032450.000|20101227032451.000|CC1|WHAT ARE THE BASIC DIFFERENCES  
20101227032451.000|20101227032453.000|CC1|BETWEEN THE BOYS AND THE GIRLS?

20101227032457.000|20101227032458.000|CC1|MADE UP OF ADULT FEMALES AND    
20101227032458.000|20101227032459.000|CC1|THEIR YOUNG.                    
20101227032459.000|20101227032501.000|CC1|AND BULLS TEND TO LEAVE THEIR   
20101227032501.000|20101227032502.000|CC1|GROUPS EARLY AND BE SOLITARY.

20101227032503.000|20101227032504.000|CC1|WITH THEIR FAMILIES AND SPEAK TO

20101227032505.000|20101227032507.000|CC1|>> Simon: BUT THE BOYS GO OFF ON

20101227032509.000|20101227032509.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: YEAH.

20101227032510.000|20101227032510.000|CC1|( LAUGHTER )                    
20101227032510.000|20101227032512.000|CC1|THEY DON'T LIKE THE GROUP LIFE. 
20101227032512.000|20101227032513.000|CC1|>> Simon: ARE THERE OTHER WAYS  
20101227032513.000|20101227032516.000|CC1|IN WHICH ELEPHANTS ARE LIKE US?

20101227032518.000|20101227032519.000|CC1|OLDER, EXPERIENCED MALES.       
20101227032519.000|20101227032520.000|CC1|>> Simon: UH-HUH.               
20101227032520.000|20101227032521.000|CC1|THEY DON'T LIKE THE YOUNG ONES? 
20101227032521.000|20101227032523.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: NO, THE YOUNG ONES  
20101227032523.000|20101227032525.000|CC1|WANT TO GET TO THE POINT TOO

20101227032526.000|20101227032528.000|CC1|( LAUGHTER )                    
20101227032528.000|20101227032529.000|CC1|( ELEPHANT SOUNDS )             
20101227032529.000|20101227032529.000|CC1|>> Simon: NOW, WHAT ARE THEY    
20101227032529.000|20101227032530.000|CC1|MAKING NOISE ABOUT RIGHT NOW?   
20101227032530.000|20101227032531.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: THAT'S THE PENELOPE 
20101227032531.000|20101227032532.000|CC1|FAMILY.                         
20101227032532.000|20101227032532.000|CC1|AND IT'S THEIR WAY OF SAYING    
20101227032532.000|20101227032534.000|CC1|HELLO.                          
20101227032534.000|20101227032535.000|CC1|>> Simon: ANDREA KNOWS IT'S THE 
20101227032535.000|20101227032537.000|CC1|PENELOPE FAMILY BECAUSE SHE     
20101227032537.000|20101227032538.000|CC1|NAMED THEM AND NEARLY A THOUSAND
20101227032538.000|20101227032540.000|CC1|OTHER ELEPHANTS.                
20101227032540.000|20101227032541.000|CC1|SHE ALSO RECOGNIZES THEM BY     
20101227032541.000|20101227032543.000|CC1|THEIR VOICES.                   
20101227032543.000|20101227032544.000|CC1|VOICES RESEARCHERS ARE TRYING TO
20101227032544.000|20101227032545.000|CC1|TRANSLATE INTO WHAT COULD       
20101227032545.000|20101227032546.000|CC1|SOMEDAY BECOME AN ELEPHANT      
20101227032546.000|20101227032551.000|CC1|DICTIONARY.                     
20101227032551.000|20101227032551.000|CC1|I FIND THIS ELEPHANT DICTIONARY 
20101227032551.000|20101227032552.000|CC1|YOU'RE COMPILING EXCEEDINGLY    
20101227032552.000|20101227032552.000|CC1|FASCINATING.                    
20101227032552.000|20101227032553.000|CC1|I MEAN, HOW LARGE A DICTIONARY  
20101227032553.000|20101227032555.000|CC1|WILL IT BE?                     
20101227032555.000|20101227032556.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: WE DON'T KNOW.

20101227032606.000|20101227032609.000|CC1|CORNELL UNIVERSITY.

20101227032612.000|20101227032615.000|CC1|STAGES.

20101227032808.000|20101227032810.000|CC1|BACK IN 2000, ANDREA FILMED THE 
20101227032810.000|20101227032812.000|CC1|DEATH OF A BABY, AND THE

20101227032818.000|20101227032822.000|CC1|TRYING TO COAX THE BABY BACK TO 
20101227032822.000|20101227032823.000|CC1|LIFE.

20101227033059.000|20101227033101.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: YES.                
20101227033101.000|20101227033102.000|CC1|THIS IS A SCENE WE FILMED ON THE
20101227033102.000|20101227033103.000|CC1|FIRST OF MAY, THE FIRST BIRTH   
20101227033103.000|20101227033106.000|CC1|WE'VE WITNESSED IN 19 YEARS.    
20101227033106.000|20101227033107.000|CC1|>> OOH!                         
20101227033107.000|20101227033110.000|CC1|LOOK AT THIS.                   
20101227033110.000|20101227033111.000|CC1|>> Simon: AFTER OOH-ING AND AAH-
20101227033111.000|20101227033113.000|CC1|ING OVER THE NEW BABY, AS ANYONE
20101227033113.000|20101227033114.000|CC1|WOULD, THE SCIENTISTS GET DOWN  
20101227033114.000|20101227033115.000|CC1|TO THE BUSINESS OF FIGURING OUT 
20101227033115.000|20101227033117.000|CC1|WHAT THE ELEPHANT SOUNDS MEAN.  
20101227033117.000|20101227033119.000|CC1|>> I'M BETTING THAT THESE TWO   
20101227033119.000|20101227033120.000|CC1|CALLS ARE THE SAME INDIVIDUAL.  
20101227033120.000|20101227033121.000|CC1|>> Turkalo: YEAH.               
20101227033121.000|20101227033122.000|CC1|>> Simon: FIGURING OUT WHICH    
20101227033122.000|20101227033123.000|CC1|ELEPHANT IS TALKING, WHERE IT'S 
20101227033123.000|20101227033124.000|CC1|LOCATED, AND WHAT IT'S SAYING   
20101227033124.000|20101227033126.000|CC1|HAS BEEN A BIG CHALLENGE.       
20101227033126.000|20101227033128.000|CC1|RESEARCHERS INITIALLY STRUNG    
20101227033128.000|20101227033129.000|CC1|NINE ACOUSTIC RECORDING DEVICES 
20101227033129.000|20101227033132.000|CC1|AROUND THE CLEARING.            
20101227033132.000|20101227033133.000|CC1|AS THE SOUND REACHED EACH       
20101227033133.000|20101227033135.000|CC1|RECORDER AT A DIFFERENT TIME,   
20101227033135.000|20101227033137.000|CC1|THEY COULD PINPOINT THE LOCATION
20101227033137.000|20101227033138.000|CC1|OF THE SPEAKING ELEPHANT.       
20101227033138.000|20101227033139.000|CC1|PICKING UP SOUNDS TOO LOW TO    
20101227033139.000|20101227033141.000|CC1|HEAR WAS ANOTHER CHALLENGE, BUT 
20101227033141.000|20101227033142.000|CC1|RECORDING THE SOUNDS NORMALLY   
20101227033142.000|20101227033143.000|CC1|AND PLAYING THEM BACK FASTER WAS
20101227033143.000|20101227033145.000|CC1|A REVELATION.                   
20101227033145.000|20101227033146.000|CC1|FOR EXAMPLE, THE CLEARING AT    
20101227033146.000|20101227033148.000|CC1|NIGHT SOUNDS LIKE THIS.         
20101227033148.000|20101227033153.000|CC1|( CRICKET SOUNDS )              
20101227033153.000|20101227033154.000|CC1|PLAYED BACK THREE TIMES FASTER, 
20101227033154.000|20101227033154.000|CC1|THIS IS WHAT THE CLEARING SOUNDS
20101227033154.000|20101227033158.000|CC1|LIKE.                           
20101227033158.000|20101227033203.000|CC1|( FAST-PACED SQUEAKING )        
20101227033203.000|20101227033204.000|CC1|YOU CAN HEAR THE ELEPHANTS'     
20101227033204.000|20101227033208.000|CC1|RUMBLING CALLS.                 
20101227033208.000|20101227033209.000|CC1|BUT TO FIGURE OUT WHAT THE CALLS
20101227033209.000|20101227033210.000|CC1|MEAN, THE CORNELL TEAM SPENDS   
20101227033210.000|20101227033212.000|CC1|MORE TIME LOOKING THAN          
20101227033212.000|20101227033213.000|CC1|LISTENING.                      
20101227033213.000|20101227033214.000|CC1|USING THESE COMPUTER-GENERATED  
20101227033214.000|20101227033215.000|CC1|SPECTROGRAMS, THEY CAN SEE THE  
20101227033215.000|20101227033216.000|CC1|LOW-FREQUENCY SOUNDS.           
20101227033216.000|20101227033217.000|CC1|>> Wrege: AND THEN, WE CAN      
20101227033217.000|20101227033218.000|CC1|ACTUALLY VISUALLY LOOK AT THE   
20101227033218.000|20101227033220.000|CC1|CALLS.                          
20101227033220.000|20101227033220.000|CC1|>> Simon: AND WHAT DOES THIS    
20101227033220.000|20101227033224.000|CC1|VISUALIZATION TELL US?          
20101227033224.000|20101227033225.000|CC1|>> Wrege: IT TELLS US THAT      
20101227033225.000|20101227033226.000|CC1|THERE'S INCREDIBLE COMPLEXITY.  
20101227033226.000|20101227033227.000|CC1|MANY OF THEIR CALLS ARE ACTUALLY
20101227033227.000|20101227033228.000|CC1|SIMILAR, IN SOME WAYS, TO HUMAN 
20101227033228.000|20101227033230.000|CC1|SPEECH.                         
20101227033230.000|20101227033231.000|CC1|>> Simon: PETER, DOES ALL THIS  
20101227033231.000|20101227033234.000|CC1|RESEARCH INTO ELEPHANT SOUNDS   
20101227033234.000|20101227033236.000|CC1|HAVE ANY PRACTICAL PURPOSE?

20101227033238.000|20101227033239.000|CC1|RECORDINGS TO MONITOR FOREST

20101227033247.000|20101227033248.000|CC1|SO, KNOWING WHERE THE ANIMALS

20101227034104.000|20101227034105.000|CC1|>> Stahl: LOOK AT THAT.

20101227034107.000|20101227034108.000|CC1|TEETH OF THE OLDEST T. REX EVER 
20101227034108.000|20101227034110.000|CC1|FOUND.                          
20101227034110.000|20101227034111.000|CC1|>> Horner: THIS LITTLE POCKET   
20101227034111.000|20101227034113.000|CC1|RIGHT HERE IN THE TEETH IS WHERE
20101227034113.000|20101227034115.000|CC1|THE NEXT TOOTH SITS.

20101227034116.000|20101227034117.000|CC1|THROUGHOUT THEIR LIFE, AND T.   
20101227034117.000|20101227034118.000|CC1|REX REPLACED ALL OF THEIR TEETH 
20101227034118.000|20101227034122.000|CC1|EVERY YEAR.                     
20101227034122.000|20101227034124.000|CC1|>> Stahl: BUT HORNER IS MOST    
20101227034124.000|20101227034125.000|CC1|FAMOUS FOR DISCOVERING A KINDER,
20101227034125.000|20101227034126.000|CC1|GENTLER SIDE OF DINOSAURS.      
20101227034126.000|20101227034128.000|CC1|HERE IN THE BADLANDS OF MONTANA,
20101227034128.000|20101227034129.000|CC1|HE AND HIS TEAM UNCOVERED THE   
20101227034129.000|20101227034131.000|CC1|FIRST DINOSAUR NESTING GROUND IN
20101227034131.000|20101227034133.000|CC1|THE WORLD, A VAST LANDSCAPE FULL
20101227034133.000|20101227034134.000|CC1|OF EGGS, NESTS, AND BABIES THAT 
20101227034134.000|20101227034135.000|CC1|HELPED CHANGE OUR IMAGE OF      
20101227034135.000|20101227034141.000|CC1|DINOSAURS.                      
20101227034141.000|20101227034143.000|CC1|THANKS TO HORNER'S INFLUENCE,   
20101227034143.000|20101227034144.000|CC1|"JURASSIC PARK" SHOWED THAT MOST
20101227034144.000|20101227034145.000|CC1|DINOSAURS WERE SOCIAL ANIMALS   
20101227034145.000|20101227034147.000|CC1|WHO LIVED IN COLONIES, AND HE'S 
20101227034147.000|20101227034147.000|CC1|FOUND EVIDENCE THEY ACTUALLY    
20101227034147.000|20101227034154.000|CC1|CARED FOR THEIR YOUNG.          
20101227034154.000|20101227034155.000|CC1|>> Horner: THIS IS THE TIBIA,   
20101227034155.000|20101227034155.000|CC1|THE SHIN BONE.                  
20101227034155.000|20101227034156.000|CC1|AND THIS IS A LITTLE LESS THAN A
20101227034156.000|20101227034157.000|CC1|MONTH OLD.                      
20101227034157.000|20101227034200.000|CC1|AND HERE, HERE IS THE SAME BONE.
20101227034200.000|20101227034206.000|CC1|>> Stahl: OF AN ADULT?          
20101227034206.000|20101227034207.000|CC1|>> Horner: OF A ONE-YEAR-OLD.   
20101227034207.000|20101227034210.000|CC1|>> Stahl: A ONE-YEAR-OLD.       
20101227034210.000|20101227034211.000|CC1|( LAUGHS )                      
20101227034211.000|20101227034212.000|CC1|HORNER FIGURED OUT THAT SUCH    
20101227034212.000|20101227034214.000|CC1|RAPIDLY GROWING BABY DINOSAURS  
20101227034214.000|20101227034216.000|CC1|COULDN'T WALK AT FIRST, MEANING 
20101227034216.000|20101227034217.000|CC1|THAT THEIR PARENTS WERE BRINGING
20101227034217.000|20101227034218.000|CC1|FOOD BACK TO THEM IN THE NEST,  
20101227034218.000|20101227034221.000|CC1|LIKE BIRDS.                     
20101227034221.000|20101227034223.000|CC1|HIS DISCOVERIES LENT SUPPORT TO 
20101227034223.000|20101227034224.000|CC1|A THEN-CONTROVERSIAL BUT NOW    
20101227034224.000|20101227034225.000|CC1|WIDELY ACCEPTED THEORY THAT     
20101227034225.000|20101227034227.000|CC1|DINOSAURS ACTUALLY GAVE RISE TO 
20101227034227.000|20101227034228.000|CC1|MODERN BIRDS.                   
20101227034228.000|20101227034231.000|CC1|IF A LITTLE KID TODAY WHO       
20101227034231.000|20101227034234.000|CC1|STUDIES ALL THIS IN SCHOOL, AND 
20101227034234.000|20101227034236.000|CC1|THEY LOOK UP IN THE SKY AND SEE 
20101227034236.000|20101227034239.000|CC1|A BIRD AND TURN TO MOM AND SAY, 
20101227034239.000|20101227034243.000|CC1|"YOU KNOW, THAT'S A DINOSAUR."  
20101227034243.000|20101227034244.000|CC1|>> Horner: THEY'RE RIGHT.       
20101227034244.000|20101227034245.000|CC1|>> Stahl: THEY'RE RIGHT.        
20101227034245.000|20101227034246.000|CC1|>> Horner: THEY'RE RIGHT.       
20101227034246.000|20101227034248.000|CC1|>> Stahl: JACK HORNER TOLD US   
20101227034248.000|20101227034249.000|CC1|THAT BIRDS ARE DINOSAURS.       
20101227034249.000|20101227034250.000|CC1|DO YOU AGREE WITH THAT?         
20101227034250.000|20101227034251.000|CC1|>> Sean Carroll: ABSOLUTELY.    
20101227034251.000|20101227034252.000|CC1|>> Stahl: SEAN CARROLL IS A

20101227034301.000|20101227034302.000|CC1|>> Stahl: DINOSAURS NEVER WENT  
20101227034302.000|20101227034303.000|CC1|EXTINCT.

20101227034305.000|20101227034305.000|CC1|>> Carroll: THERE WAS AN        
20101227034305.000|20101227034306.000|CC1|ASTEROID EVENT THAT TOOK OUT A  
20101227034306.000|20101227034307.000|CC1|LOT OF LIFE ON EARTH, INCLUDING 
20101227034307.000|20101227034307.000|CC1|T. REX AND ALL THE MOST FAMOUS

20101227034310.000|20101227034312.000|CC1|BUT THIS OTHER GROUP, WHAT WE   
20101227034312.000|20101227034313.000|CC1|CALL BIRDS, MADE IT THROUGH, AND

20101227034314.000|20101227034315.000|CC1|SPECIES OF BIRDS STILL AROUND   
20101227034315.000|20101227034316.000|CC1|TODAY.                          
20101227034316.000|20101227034318.000|CC1|>> Stahl: THE DINOSAUR-BIRD

20101227034319.000|20101227034321.000|CC1|NOW, BUT THAT HASN'T STOPPED

20101227034515.000|20101227034516.000|CC1|>> Stahl: HORNER'S PRACTICE OF

20101227034606.000|20101227034608.000|CC1|>> Stahl: JACK NAMED THE T. REX 
20101227034608.000|20101227034610.000|CC1|"B-REX"-- IN BOB'S HONOR-- AND

20101227034613.000|20101227034613.000|CC1|>> Horner: THIS WAS UNDER 50    
20101227034613.000|20101227034615.000|CC1|FEET OF ROCK.                   
20101227034615.000|20101227034616.000|CC1|I MEAN, THIS WAS IN A TERRIBLE  
20101227034616.000|20101227034616.000|CC1|PLACE.                          
20101227034616.000|20101227034617.000|CC1|THERE WAS NO ROAD TO IT.        
20101227034617.000|20101227034621.000|CC1|THERE WAS NO ACCESS TO IT.      
20101227034621.000|20101227034622.000|CC1|AND SO, FOR THE NEXT THREE      
20101227034622.000|20101227034624.000|CC1|SUMMERS, WE SENT OUT CLIMBING   
20101227034624.000|20101227034625.000|CC1|CREWS, PEOPLE THAT COULD RAPPEL 
20101227034625.000|20101227034627.000|CC1|DOWN CLIFFS WITH JACKHAMMERS.

20101227034638.000|20101227034642.000|CC1|THE GROUND.

20101227034700.000|20101227034701.000|CC1|PIECE I PULLED OUT, I PICKED IT 
20101227034701.000|20101227034703.000|CC1|UP AND I LOOKED AT IT.

20101227034705.000|20101227034707.000|CC1|IT'S PREGNANT."

20101227034707.000|20101227034708.000|CC1|AS I UNDERSTAND IT, THAT ANYONE

20101227034709.000|20101227034712.000|CC1|GENDER IN ANY DINOSAUR.

20101227034713.000|20101227034714.000|CC1|>> Stahl: MARY RECOGNIZED A     
20101227034714.000|20101227034716.000|CC1|SPECIFIC TYPE OF BONE CALLED    
20101227034716.000|20101227034720.000|CC1|MEDULLARY BONE, WHICH FEMALE    
20101227034720.000|20101227034721.000|CC1|BIRDS PRODUCE WHEN THEY'RE ABOUT
20101227034721.000|20101227034725.000|CC1|TO LAY EGGS.                    
20101227034725.000|20101227034726.000|CC1|NO ONE HAD EVER FOUND IT BEFORE 
20101227034726.000|20101227034728.000|CC1|IN A DINOSAUR.

20101227034735.000|20101227034736.000|CC1|>> Horner: SHE CALLS UP AND     
20101227034736.000|20101227034738.000|CC1|SAYS, "WE HAVE MEDULLARY BONE." 
20101227034738.000|20101227034738.000|CC1|>> Stahl: OH, NOW, THIS HAD TO  
20101227034738.000|20101227034741.000|CC1|BE THRILLING.                   
20101227034741.000|20101227034743.000|CC1|>> Horner: YES.

20101227034744.000|20101227034746.000|CC1|AND THAT WASN'T ALL.            
20101227034746.000|20101227034747.000|CC1|>> Stahl: WHAT HAPPENED NEXT    
20101227034747.000|20101227034751.000|CC1|HAPPENED BY MISTAKE.            
20101227034751.000|20101227034752.000|CC1|MARY PUT SOME FRAGMENTS OF THE  
20101227034752.000|20101227034753.000|CC1|BONE IN ACID TO DISSOLVE AWAY
